page.title: 09Indirect Communications
page.content: {Newspapers}are an easy way of com- municating with many people.The Herald Press prints 6000 gazettes a day.This process does not take place in Carnoustie but the{"Guide and Gazette" is the area's local paper.Local businesses use the paper to advertise. Also ordinary people can place adverts.Local news takes up most space,for example the winners of school sports,fund-raising events and other things of interest. {Television}is another good example of indirect communication.Judging on the sales of one Carnoustie T.V. shop, the most popular sets in the area are I.T.T.,Ferguson and Sanyo.Although it is hard to estimate,Grampian Tele- vision seems to be the most popular channel for most age groups. This is interesting as it is the regional channel,with plenty of local news.
